intro: Tithymalus esula subsp. mosanus, commonly known as the Alpine tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
